name: runtsqltunittests
description: Run tSQLt Unit Tests and extract its results and Code Coverage
author: Ricardo Serradas

inputs.name: connectionString
inputs.label: SQL Server Connection String
inputs.helpMarkDown: The SQL Server Connection String to connect to the database

inputs.name: queryTimeout
inputs.label: SQL Connection Timeout
inputs.helpMarkDown: The timeout to be used on Connection Strings to SQL Server

inputs.name: runAllTests
inputs.label: Run all test suites and test cases
inputs.helpMarkDown: If you want to run specific tests, uncheck this option and provide further information on the fields below.

inputs.name: testOrClassName
inputs.label: The name of the Test Class or Test Case you want to run
inputs.helpMarkDown: If you're providing a test case, it **must** be preceeded by the Test Class name. E.g., [MyTestClass].[Test if something is true]

inputs.name: rootOutput
inputs.label: The root folder to store all the output for this task
inputs.helpMarkDown: The output from this task will be dropped under `$(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)/tSQLt-out` unless modified here.

inputs.name: testResultsFileName
inputs.label: The name for the Test Results XML report
inputs.helpMarkDown: You're going to need it to use the Publish Test Results task.

inputs.name: enableCodeCoverage
inputs.label: Enable Code Coverage
inputs.helpMarkDown: If you want Cobertura reports to be generated for the test execution, enable this.

inputs.name: coberturaFileName
inputs.label: The name for the Cobertura Code Coverage XML report
inputs.helpMarkDown: You're going to need it to use the Publish Test Results task.

inputs.name: htmlReportsOutput
inputs.label: HTML reports output
inputs.helpMarkDown: The folder to store the report that needs to be published using the Publish Code Coverage results.

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The folder to have all working files.
